title: The Cornell University Witchcraft Collection: Home | Cornell University
snippet: Cornell's Witchcraft Collection contains over 3,000 titles documenting the history of the Inquisition and the persecution of witchcraft, primarily in Europe.

title: About the Academy - EMBASSY OF THE FREE MIND
About the Embassy of the Free Mind - EMBASSY OF THE FREE MIND
snippet: The Embassy of the Free Mind is a place where you can find wisdom from all over the world, where images and texts will tell you centuries-old stories created by free thinkers.

title: About the library - EMBASSY OF THE FREE MIND
snippet: The Bibliotheca Philosophica Hermetica and the House with the Heads are inseparably linked with Amsterdam and its history of tolerance, freedom of expression and freedom of the press.

title: About the museum - EMBASSY OF THE FREE MIND
snippet: Make a journey of discovery through 2,000 years of collected wisdom inspired by the images and texts from the Bibliotheca Philosophica Hermetica collection.

title: Three Doors of Entry - EMBASSY OF THE FREE MIND
Art Gallery — The Occult Library
snippet: Within this section, a number of visual artists and their works are detailed & displayed. As the aesthetic expressions of the community, artists, illustrators, and their works constitute a vital component of the occult milieu. Many artistic pieces here accompany & adorn the texts of an author or publisher. Others stand alone in their own right as expressions of practice, experience, knowledge, and

title: Forthcoming — The Occult Library
snippet: Titles are often announced by publishers many months in advance, often long before even a period of preorder is underway. Our goal with this page to display up to date information on any titles that have been shown as forthcoming. Any listing here shown is done so with the information publically provided and as such is subject to change. If a title is removed from this page but is not listed in th

title: People & Places — The Occult Library
snippet: The occult community is a constellation of people, groups, organizations, traditions, and cultures. The relationships and bonds between them allow occult lifeways to grow, thrive, and find expression. Below, you will find a number of pages detailing aspects of the occult community. These pages have been included as a resource for supporting and bolstering authors, artists, shops, artisans, events,

title: Periodicals & Zines — The Occult Library
snippet: In the occult community, periodicals are constituted by journals, zines, pamphlets, and more. Often, publishers are working under the auspices of small press, fine edition environments. However, many diverse publishers large & small offer periodicals. Subjects and topics vary greatly: they range from firsthand essays on practice, to scholarly works on history, folklore, and culture. Below, you wil

title: Publishers — The Occult Library
snippet: Publishers serve as vehicles for elevating, proliferating, and commemorating the work of authors. They offer works which color and express the author’s intent, providing unique pieces to the occult community. Many of these stand alone as works of art in their own right. Within this space, a comprehensive list of a given publisher’s works may be found – each with detailed information and photos. Ea

title: Resources — The Occult Library
snippet: For those looking to expand on the information cataloged through the Occult Library, a list of primary & secondary-source materials from the fields of lay scholarship and academic research can be found here. Please select a given resource, where information and links can offer you a pathway to expanding your knowledge of the occult community and its materia.

title: The Occult Library
snippet: The Occult Library is a free, volunteer-managed resource committed to sharing accurate, up-to-date information. We gather content from publisher and author websites, direct correspondence, staff research and photography, and occasional online searches. If you own any image or text included here and wish to request its removal or proper attribution, please contact us, and we’ll respond promptly.

title: The Occult Library
snippet: Welcome to The Occult Library—your volunteer-run, nonprofit hub for all things occult, from books and art, to movies, TV shows, podcasts, and more. We maintain an ever-expanding catalog of active and retired publishers, authors, artists, bookstores, artisans, and beyond. Please note we do not offer reading facilities; instead, our goal is to serve as a central resource for discovering and research

title: The Occult Library
snippet: Welcome to The Occult Library—your volunteer-run, nonprofit hub for all things occult, from books and art, to movies, TV shows, podcasts, and more. We maintain an ever-expanding catalog of active and retired publishers, authors, artists, bookstores, artisans, and beyond. Please note we do not offer reading facilities; instead, our goal is to serve as a central resource for discovering and research
